item.title: What's new for the Microsoft Fluent UI Blazor library 4.9
item.description: Okay, I did not expect us to publish another new version before the summer holiday, but yet here we are. The amount of changes, additions, enhancements and fixes was too big to leave it lying around till later. Read on to find out about the most prominent highlights of this release. And enjoy the summer. I know I will!

item.title: Proton launches its own version of Google Docs
item.description: Proton now has its own version of Google Docs in its Drive cloud storage service, and like the company's other products, it comes with end-to-end encryption.

item.title: [July 2nd 2024] We have proved "BB(5) = 47,176,870"
item.description: BB(5) = 47,176,870 We are extremely happy to announce that, after two years of intense collaboration, the goal of the Busy Beaver Challenge has been reached: the conjecture “BB(5) = 47,176,870” is proved. Exceeding our expectations, the proof has been formally written in Coq by collaborator mxdys whose work improves on and/or uses the contributions of more than 10 other bbchallenge contributors (see credits). The formal theorem’s statement was reviewed by independent Coq experts (see credits) ...
item.author: (cosmo)

item.title: Binary Classification Using LightGBM -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: Dr. James McCaffrey from Microsoft Research presents a full-code, step-by-step tutorial on using the LightGBM tree-based system to perform binary classification (predicting a discrete variable that has exactly two possible values).

item.title: 10 Most Common Errors in SPF Records
item.description: In our analysis of the SPF records of the top 1 million websites, we uncovered over 20,000 domains with invalid SPF setups. In this blog post, we not only reveal the ten most common types of errors we encountered but also offer advice on how to avoid these issues, along with practical tips for fixing them.

item.title: How to prevent stagnation while building products alone
item.description: With a lack of external motivators, a solo-developer needs to proactively manage their interest in a project. Time-bound prediction games can help.

item.title: Test-Driven Development: A Guide to Improving Software Quality

item.title: Ryzen 7 Mini-PC makes a power-efficient VM host
item.description: When I saw the first reviews of the ASRock DeskMini X600 barebone, I was immediately interested in building a home-lab hypervisor (VM host) with it. Apparently, the DeskMini X600 uses less than 10W of power but supports latest-generation AMD CPUs like the Ryzen 7 8700G!

item.title: Why bare-metal Debian (and Raspberry Pi OS) is not a good choice for most Embedded Systems
item.description: Quite a few embedded vendors nowadays ship Debian or some derivative by default, specially for the hobbyist sector, but I don’t think people realize that there isn’t an expectation that Debian will be their production operating system, and when with ‘production’ I don’t mean one or two devices: by all means, if that’s your scale, continue using Debian in pet machines instead, that’s very much fine.
item.author: (Leonardo Held, Torizon Developer)
